page.title: 08SPREYTON CHURCH BELL RINGERS
page.content: In the tower of St.Michael's Church,Spreyton,there are six bells dating back to 1695. There are sixteen bell ringers including learners. The bells are rung on most Sundays for the service and every Tuesday evening,during the winter for practising. The annual St. Michael's Fayre,held in June,was started, as a result of a competition among different parishes, for the Viscount Lambert Bell Ringers Shield. During the winter months,the parishes of South Tawton, Bow and Spreyton join in a league and an outing takes place for the ringers to visit other towers in Devon. Ken Vile teaches the new ringers and Will Towell,the captain,has been ringing for sixty eight years.
